column4: before you try to start the next session do this click on session and choose gnome over default, if that does not fix it then you may need to take some other action, have you added some software or removed some that you know of?
I haven't removed any - but I have added a few things (games / programs / java / drivers / etc. -- and upgraded what was on it of course)
okay well try what I suggested first if that fails I would try 'apt-get install ubuntu-desktop' in a terminal
okay then it has not been uninstalled :-)
something funny in the back of my mind - do this - ls -al ~gkxjmrep/.I*
it should be your local user
were you moving from breezy to daooer
were you moving from breezy to dapper
well if you knew why the gasp ? ;-)

it is unstable - that means it is not ready, it scares me when I see people typing dapper in the channel, so I hit that thing, I do a lot of hours on irc and I wish dist upgrade came with a big warning for unstable, that is one of two good ideas I have had today, must register them on the wiki or launchpad or somewhere

still not a very polite way of letting someone know something they might know already. Just because you hear a gasp or a sigh or something , doesn't mean that people start whining and blaming everyone but themselves.

I've been using some form of linux for roughly 7 years now - I'm currently in the middle of a computer science education, I know a fair bit about linux and I am perfectly aware of what "beta" or "unstable" implies in connection to software.. Yet, I gasp when something freezes up my linux box so bad that I have to hard-reboot it... That doesn't make me a linux newbie or a pain in the butt to you and the others in here..
